examples: That situation changed in 2013, when a British newspaper reported that the NSA collected phone records from millions of customers every day.

meanings.definition: To gain, to come to have.

meanings.definition: To act within the rules in an exact way.
examples: But those in charge of protecting American security thought the limitations on surveillance of suspicious people were too strict.

meanings.definition: To act within the rules in an exact way.

meanings.definition: Difficult to manage or get out of.
examples: But those in charge of protecting American security thought the limitations on surveillance of suspicious people were to tight.

meanings.definition: Something that a person should do because it is right or fair; responsibility.
examples: Snowden was opposed to the massive NSA surveillance, and felt it was his duty as a patriot to reveal its existence.

meanings.definition: Easy to see or notice because of some difference.
examples: Many members of Congress and prominent judges have begun to take action against NSA surveillance programs.

images.caption: The bold colors of the mural make it stand out in this gray city setting.

meanings.definition: Known and praised by many; famous.

meanings.definition: Known and praised by many; famous.

meanings.definition: To monitor (a telephone line) by means of a concealed device attached to the wires of a telephone.
examples: The police sometimes wiretap telephone lines to catch criminals.

meanings.definition: One who loves, supports, and defends their country.
examples: People who have fought to preserve their country's freedoms are patriots.

images.alt: Person in military uniform saluting an American flag
images.description: A large American flag is the background. A person in military uniform stands and salutes the flag.

meanings.definition: To get rid of or destroy.
examples: He is trying to eliminate weeds from his garden.

images.caption: This person is eliminating the weeds by picking them from the dirt.

meanings.definition: The start or cause of something.
examples: Lake Victoria is the source of the Nile River.
